question:
The Dugong (Sea Cow) is found in India in __:
1.Gulf of Katch
2.Gulf of Mannar
3.Andaman & Nicobar Islands
Choose the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Largest Dugong was as long as 13.5 ft and was found in Gulf of Katch in India. In India, they are found in Gulf of Kutch, the only population remaining in western India and Gulf of Mannar. The Gulf of Mannar Biosphere (GoMB) has the largest population of dugongs in India. They are also found near the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.
